TopicTitle: How do i find my kerbals, or get them back when they are MIA or KIA

Articles.Content:
I accidentally crashed a couple space planes and the three main characters you get at the start 
(Bob, Bill, and Jeb) are all MIA/KIA. how do i get them back, i would love to have them back in the cockpit of many spacecraft.

Note, this is in sandbox mode

 

Edited May 18, 2020 by Grand Antinov

KIA is permanent.

For MIA, all you should have to do is play for a few days of game time, and they will show back up in the Astronaut Complex, ready for a new mission.

If you selected “Missing crews respawn” in the settings when you started the save game, missing crew members will turn up again after a while even if they ‘died’ during a mission. Exactly how long that will take is also in the settings but it usually defaults to 2 hours in easy mode but is switched off entirely in hard mode. I accidentally killed off Jeb in my first save game due to an unfortunate lack of parachutes issue and time warping when I bailed him out so his own chute couldn’t deploy in time .
 

Note that this doesn’t work if they're listed as KIA, for that you’ll have to edit the save file called persistent.sfs and change their status from Dead to Available (and delete the flight logs where they died, so they don’t remember it happening/the game doesn’t kill them off again). Save files can be pretty huge (my current one is getting close to 2 million lines!) but if you do a case-sensitive search for KERBAL it should get you to your crew roster pretty quickly.

6 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

If you selected “Missing crews respawn” in the settings when you started the save game, missing crew members will turn up again after a while even if they ‘died’ during a mission. Exactly how long that will take is also in the settings but it usually defaults to 2 hours in easy mode but is switched off entirely in hard mode. I accidentally killed off Jeb in my first save game due to an unfortunate lack of parachutes issue and time warping when I bailed him out so his own chute couldn’t deploy in time .
 

Note that this doesn’t work if they're listed as KIA, for that you’ll have to edit the save file called persistent.sfs and change their status from Dead to Available (and delete the flight logs where they died, so they don’t remember it happening/the game doesn’t kill them off again). Save files can be pretty huge (my current one is getting close to 2 million lines!) but if you do a case-sensitive search for KERBAL it should get you to your crew roster pretty quickly.

This is the best answer.

There's also the immediate "Revert Flight" option after a catastrophic crash - which can help you when you're making / testing really bad air/spacecraft.  If you're RPGing the game, this is a no-no (death is part of any space development).  If you're learning / playing for fun (like me) do it frequently and never admit it to the hard-core players!
There is another way, you can set their state to Available in the persistent.sfs, but that is cheating.
